website_summaries.verdict: A well-made bargain carrier that handles well on all surfaces, although you'll probably want to purchase your own straps to use with it.
pros: Features aluminum construction and 10-inch PU foam tires
Works well on all surfaces, including sand
cons: Some buyers had problems with the tires arriving flat or going flat, and say their composition makes them hard to re-inflate
Strap has a plastic buckle and is not durable

customer_reviews.title: Hello Dolly! So nice to have u where you belong.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Well made. The dolly is easy to assemble--just fold out the sides, slide the wheels on and put the pins in. That's it. The tires are filled with some kind of foam material and can never go flat. And they don't stink like other reviews mentioned. I position the dolly right under the seat area, strap it down with two 3' bungee cords, and pull it to the shoreline. It rolls over rocks, sand, and whatever with ease. Have not used the included strap. And to think last year I carried that kayak everywhere. Duh.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Save your shoulders, great carrier
customer_reviews.text: So easy to assemble, just one pin in each wheel, no tools required. It traverses well thru gravel and grass. Folds up to fit in car trunk sooner. My only regret is not buying it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: noputt3

customer_reviews.title: It does the job if you secure it properly
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty good if you secure the kayak to it with a bungee cord or strap. (I find a bungee cord easier to use and I also use it to secure the carrier when not in use and folded up.) It took a little practice and experimenting to determine the best place to put the carrier under the kayak (may vary depending on your height). I bought this model with non-inflatable tires because I have another one with inflatable tires and every time I need to use it, I have to stop to pump the tires.
customer_reviews.author: DJ-Miami

customer_reviews.title: For the money, you will not find anything better.
customer_reviews.text: Do not pay a hundred dollars for a similar product! This one works great. There are some reviews the mention deflated tires. I was not so unlucky. But since there is no way to re-inflate these once they do go flat, I recommend drilling holes in the rubber and filling them with construction foam insulation available on this site or any hardware store. Its better than air and long term use.
customer_reviews.author: ____Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Durable carrier - rolls nice
customer_reviews.text: I used this in the Allagash for 2 long portages. The airless tires rolled nicely. I used a couple additional straps to keep the dolly on tight but other than that - it worked very well. A friend had a similar set that also worked well and an air filled set where the tire came off during a portage...
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Very sweet, indeed!
customer_reviews.text: I am an older woman and love my 10' Pelican sit in kayak. This sweet cart is easy peasy to use. After putting the kayak on the cart, I found 2 small black loops near each wheel that I used to thread tbe included strap through and then around my kayak seat. Perfect, sturdy and I'm a happy paddler!
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Now the kayaks get used
customer_reviews.text: Very good product at a good price. Reading other reviews, the only complaints about this dolly was the petroleum smell of the wheels and the plastic buckle on the tie down strap. Evidently this company listened and made changes. On the two I purchased, there was no smell at all from the wheels and the buckle on the tie down is a good study metal. We didn't use our kayaks as often as we wanted because it was such a pain to carry them from the house to the lake. Now we put them on the dollys, strap them down and go. And it's rough terrain to the lake (rocks and roots) but the dollys handle it with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far I like it. The wheels didn't smell when it first ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I like it. The wheels didn't smell when it first arrived. We put it in the garage, then noticed an odor. It wasn't bad, once I realized what it was. Isaw one of these being used at Pinecrest Lake in the Sierras last summer. The onwer was happy with it. I'll use it this summer. Nice to be able to deal with kayak by myself. My friend will get one, too. 'Beats carrying 2 kayaks down to the shore. Not as easy to do at ages 81 & 86!
customer_reviews.author: emily ellen lathlean

customer_reviews.title: Does not accommodate my 14' tandem Ocean Kayak. The ...
customer_reviews.text: Does not accommodate my 14' tandem Ocean Kayak. The cart is built well, and I'm sure it works well for smaller kayaks/canoes but I need something much wider so the kayak can sit flush. Otherwise, the kayak just spins on the cart. I pull the kayak right and the cart goes left. The cart needs to be wider with side braces so it can keep the kayak in place. I'll probably end up making something out of PVC.
customer_reviews.author: Duck Farm

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long?
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why I waited so long for this, but I am very glad I purchased it. Assembly is a snap. It stays in place while I put my kayak on and take it off. No issues as all with strapping it to the yak. As others have commented, these tires are solid foam and cannot deflate. My fully load yak with all my fishing gear and cooler were barely noticeable on this cart over asphalt, grass, gravel, and somehwat packed sand. It also attached easily to my crate on the back of my yak while I fish with the same strap that is used to attach the cart to the yak. Don't wait. Just get it.
customer_reviews.author: ITGeek

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the money. It will be perfect, if it has seal real bearings. It has no bearings at all. I had to instal rubber O rings and large washer on inner and outer side of each wheel to protect the aluminium shaft from send getting in between bore of wheels and shaft.. Also, I am cleaning(and lubricating) the shaft 3x a year from send and dust.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ease of use
customer_reviews.text: This dolly will do the job for small fishing kayaks 10 - 12 foot length & may work fine on larger ones but i bought it for a 10 ft kayak. It's easy to use & if you don't mind hard wheels as i don't it's a great convenience. Comes with the tie down strap &n the only thing you need to put together are the wheels. Unless your looking for soft tires or scupper tubes this little guy will work just fine. A great price & well built.
customer_reviews.author: paul levine

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Some of the negative reviews started to scare me off a bit, but, I am glad I didn't listen to them! There was no tire smell, the canoe stayed on perfectly (I did use an extra strap just in case) and it rolled over, dirt, sand, gravel, rocks and a trail with sticks and debris on it with no problem! My wife could pull the whole rig herself (see photo), and when we worked together it was effortless, even while going up inclines. It fit perfectly inside the canoe and took up very little space (I strapped it to the middle support incase we tipped over!). I would definitely buy another one!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Easy to transport.  Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I used this to move my flat bottom row boat to and from the water from my dock space, approx 40'. Works better going in, dry, but the water on the bottom on the boat, coming out of the water caused slipping on the foam cushions. Have to figure a better way to stablilize when the boat bottom is wet. Overall, built well and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: DaveBocc

customer_reviews.title: Works well - pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: This transported two 8ft sit on top kayaks easily (one on top of the other) at the same time over some pretty rough terrain. Make sure the lash provided is pulling the kayak down into the carrier frame. Just used a couple of extra spring buckle lashes around the two kayaks and made sure the load was 'balanced' well. Was pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Scotsman

customer_reviews.title: Works well on small pram
customer_reviews.text: Like the wheels. Compact, folding, foam/rubber wheels so no flats. Important for me, and strong suggestion for users is to get a cam strap to lock wheels in place. Then you are good to go. Can easily wheel 7.5' boat around on pavement, dirt road, grassy areas. Tougher in sand or over uneven terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Fits my kayak well
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to assemble, and to disassemble when using your kayak. It is light weight, but holds my kayak great and allows me to maneuver it easily. No directions came with it on how to place your kayak so I looked at some pictures online and figured it out.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Not working for me
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it’s me but this is too hard for me to get my kayak secured on.
customer_reviews.author: Whatever It’s my opinion

customer_reviews.title: Well made and really useful!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really impressed with the build quality of this thing and how much easier it is to get my 13ft kayak into the water. I used to carry the kayak on my shoulders and it can get heavy depending on how far you go, so I thought I would try this. I'm really glad I bought it! And it's easy to bungie onto the back of the kayak while you're floating so you have it with you.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: poor design
customer_reviews.text: This product is fantastic if you are using it from your car to a paved ramp. If you plan to use it for the beach.... FORGET ABOUT IT... the wheels, while they are wide, sink into the sand like a knife edge once the weight of the kayak is on them. We worked harder to get the 1st kayak to the water than carrying the next two and dragging them on the sand. The wheel in soft sand is just not the right style.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Frustrating! Not rubber tires - cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: I have tried this over 10x now and still have trouble keeping my paddle board secured, just so frustrating - wish you could mechanically lock the arms so they would not collapse on non-smooth terrain. Tires are cheap plastic and not rubber as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Swaf

customer_reviews.title: Good product for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Good product for a good price, I use it to take my kayak to a salt marsh by my house, & it handles the uneven terrain fine; I use a couple of bungee cords to fix the kayak on it which is a ton easier than straps
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Not for sand
customer_reviews.text: Nice dolly, works well. Only drawback is that it does roll well in sand. I know it’s says that it good for sand, but it’s not. It was like dragging the kayak all the way to the beach because the tires don’t roll in sand.
customer_reviews.author: Alan M.

customer_reviews.title: Good for 1 or 2 weekend use
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap made, would not have purchased if i had know construction is so poor. Will not make many trips to beach, will fall apart. The 199$ product sold is by far superior and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Zman45

customer_reviews.title: Perished around valve would be best guess as if you try to inflate there is ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for one 100 yard pull. Next time i went to use it ( 2 months later ) one tire was flat. Went to inflate and it became quickly apparent that the tube was destroyed. Not a hole or a leak but slashed or ripped somehow. NO evidence of puncture originally at all after first use. Perished around valve would be best guess as if you try to inflate there is zero resistance and it doesn't even try to inflate. Junk after one use.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL

customer_reviews.title: Still working on it
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our 12 foot kayak to take it down to the beach, it seems to be a good product but we are still working on trying to get our kayak to stay on it, especially when we turn it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Easy transportable wheels come right out for storing away
customer_reviews.text: Easy transportable wheels come right out for storing away. No need to fill air with the never flat rubber. No smell, works great as advertised. Use it for my big fishing kayak, very durable wheelie cart. Cant beat the price, probably can't beat the quality either.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise the trolley works good. I tailored how I attach mine
customer_reviews.text: The reason I am not giving a 5 star is because it came with a flat tire and the replacement tire that took 10 days to get to me also went flat, took another 4-5 days to get that tire too. Otherwise the trolley works good. I tailored how I attach mine. I use rubber bungie cords and an addition strap to make it tight. Other wise the dolly will fold up on you, or the kayak will slide off. You will probably have to find what works for you.
customer_reviews.author: Evie

customer_reviews.title: Why all the haters?
customer_reviews.text: This carrier works great when transporting your kayak by yourself. Yes the tires smell new. I had no issues airing up the tires, and set it in the garage. In a few days, there was no smell from the tires and it rolls well over many surfaces in cluding sand, gravel, and pavement. People that have complaints on this roller just don't know how to seat a tire when airing up or don't have the outsode to leave it if the smell is offensive. Instructions are minimal, but this is not rocket surgery, it is only in a few pieces. It is easy to assemble and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Hi Def Watcher

customer_reviews.title: Kayak cart
customer_reviews.text: l do like this kayak cart. I have used it several times. Usually I go fishing by myself, l get dropped off ,use the cart and pull my kayak on some what level ground ,it pulls very easy. At the end of my float I pull across pav ement and some gravel and up a slight grade , depending on how heavy I have loaded it still pulls good and the cart doesn't slip around. The cart folded, fits nicely across the the front of my kayak . I would recommend this cart to my friends
customer_reviews.author: Dale B.

customer_reviews.title: Great once you figure it out
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured out how to strap my canoe down it worked great. I've seen several comments saying the same thing. It would be nice if the manufacturer would post a video or instructions to make it easier. If instructions were included this would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Davis

customer_reviews.title: How to figure the strap out because the directions are very vague
customer_reviews.text: At first we felt the instructions for the strap was not informative. So after trying different ways he figured the best way was to start strap on one side of frame throw both sides of strap across the kayak and go up around the other side of frame and tighten the strap down. Works great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Yak Cart
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my Perception Hook Angler. I use adjustable bungies instead of the original strap. My preference and a lot quicker. Have towed my Yak across lawns, driveways, gravel roads with no problems whatsoever...just be sure that bungies (or strap) are tight. I have a friend who saw mine and his order is probably in the mail now. Also, having Non-pneumatic tires is the best way to go...no flats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tires are great don't have to worry about filling them ever
customer_reviews.text: Tires are great don't have to worry about filling them ever. I have a hard time balancing my kayak on it and the shape of the dolly does not fit the bottom of the kayak. Hard to keep the kayak on top of the pads with out ratcheting the s*** out of it. The small ratchet belt that comes with it does not keep a firm hold on the kayak. I had to readjust every 100 ft. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Best choice for the money
customer_reviews.text: This kayak cart works great with my 90 pound 12 foot kayak. The molded rubber tires are a real plus as I do not have to worry about them getting punctured and they are not hard plastic that can break easily. I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dolfan101

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This carrier is very hard to use. The strap does not fit well on the carrier and you have to rig it up to fit around your kayak. The clips that attach the wheels rub against the air caps and destroy the metal. After only one day of use I had a flat tire due to this problem. The wheels are also made of a very smelly rubber so I would not recommend leaving in your car or garage for long. I left it outside on my kayak. In this case you get what you pay for so buy something that will work long term. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Amy W.

customer_reviews.title: Take Your Turn
customer_reviews.text: Great price, easy to assemble. This works great if you’re hauling your kayak on a paved or cement path and you’re hauling it in a straight line. However, if you need to turn at all...good luck...this thing keeps going straight. I’ve tried securing it to my kayak multiple ways, but it still won’t turn. I’d give it 5 stars if I only had to travel in straight lines. This is totally useless for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leave the wife at home!
customer_reviews.text: Used it this weekend at a boat launch that was built on a steep hill. I have a 118 lb canoe with a 2.5 HP motor and my wife has trouble helping me carry it. This carrier is so easy to use that I'm thinking of leaving her at home next time! There was a problem with smell from the wheels when I first got it. A little bit of scrubbing got rid of it fast.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Great Trolley for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I have several kayak trolleys. This is the least expensive, however, it works just as well as the more expensive models. Go for it. I noted the reviews regarding the smell from the tires. It is true but this issue should not deter you from purchasing this trolley. I put my wheels outside on the deck to air out. I also read another review where the buyer washed the tires with soap. If you frequent bike shops the smell from the bike tires is similar to the trolley wheels expect much, much, stronger. This trolley should last years.
customer_reviews.author: Poor Ol' Johnny Ray

customer_reviews.title: Good compact wheels
customer_reviews.text: This is a good set of wheels for kayaks. Lightweight, easy to disassemble and reassemble for storing inside a kayak. Large, sturdy wheels work well when rolling over small roots and obstacles. If not strapped down tightly it will come loose or wobble around.
customer_reviews.author: Chris yarbrough

customer_reviews.title: Get way to move yer Yak!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this on a Pescador Pro 12, 65ish lbs, up and down steep grades, gravel, grass, pavement, lake front, and it works. Mine has a metal buckle so no problems so far. It makes moving Yaks a lot easier!
customer_reviews.author: M. Brady

customer_reviews.title: Great cart!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 25 year old daughter and she loves it. Lightweight & compact, it allows her to get her 12'10", 40 lb. kayak from the car to the river on her own. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: TheMadCook

customer_reviews.title: Good wheels for the money
customer_reviews.text: I pull a 13 foot duel kayak with no problem
customer_reviews.author: J. Hart

customer_reviews.title: This one is great. I can load my Wilderness Systems Pamlico 160T ...
customer_reviews.text: Was a little nervous buying this online to replace my old cart (similar to this one but with inflatable tires) that I bought for twice as much at REI. This one is great. I can load my Wilderness Systems Pamlico 160T onto it no problem. My old one would constantly collapse on me during loading, and while transporting my kayak. Half the price of REI and made in the same place: China. Buy it here!
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Well built and rolls nicely on big tires. Yes, as others say in their reviews, the tires smell big time but, some soap and a scrub brush takes care of that. The plastic buckles on the included strap worried me so I replaced it with a more robust strap/buckle. Tow a 53 pound kayak with another 10 pounds of gear in it through the woods behind my Gator with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Warbird

customer_reviews.title: These carts work great.
customer_reviews.text: We have two different size kayaks. One is wider than the other. These carts work great for either size kayak.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen Callison

customer_reviews.title: Putting the wheels on was super easy. I haven't actually had to use it ...
customer_reviews.text: Putting the wheels on was super easy. I haven't actually had to use it yet but looks like it will work just fine for those times when the lake is to far away to carry my kayak on my shoulders
customer_reviews.author: Sirian Angel

customer_reviews.title: Awful smell - but can't imagine having an issue with the product
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this works perfectly but the plastic wheels smelled like gas. This was delivered the same day as new living from furniture and I kept spraying the furniture thinking maybe it was from sitting in a warehouse somewhere. Finally realized it was the box with my dolly. Opened it up and am letting it sit outside for a few days. The dolly looks very heavy/sturdy and can't wait until I get to use her out!!
customer_reviews.author: BlueEyes

customer_reviews.title: Could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to get attached to the kayak although once on it helps wheel around.
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: Convenience at your finger tips!
customer_reviews.text: Didnt notice any smell, so that was nice esp after reading reviews that mentioned it. Its a life saver, making transporting my 10 ft kayak a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: Sass Water in Washington

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice boat carrier. It rolls nice even over rough ground, and takes most of the work out of transporting my kayak. It also folds up fairly small so you can transport it in your canoe easily. I use it for my kayak and to transport it on the kayak you need to remove the wheels which is easily done. I read in the customer reviews before purchasing this carrier that the wheels smell very bad and they do. But after a few weeks, most of the bad smell has worn off. It was just what I was looking for and I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cromwell

customer_reviews.title: This dolly is terrific. I live on a lake but still need ...
customer_reviews.text: This dolly is terrific. I live on a lake but still need to transport the kayak back & forth to my house. I've gotten lots of interest from neighbors. This is very easy to use & even though it did not come with instructions, it was pretty easy to figure out. From reading previous reviews - the tires are very smelly. When it is delivered, open the box outside & leave the dolly outside to let the tire smell dissipate - store it inside after your boating season is over.
customer_reviews.author: lisapd

customer_reviews.title: Works real good
customer_reviews.text: This little dolly is for sale all over the net. And, it's pretty good for the money. I slide out my kayak and set it on the cart and I'm good to go. I haven't even secured it with the included strap. My kayak is a 12 footer, sit-on style and this cart handles it just fine. One tire kept going soft, but I put some of that green sealer in it and it holds air now. The tires do smell, but that's life! I would recommend this for a low budget solution for the solitary man.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as the detail lists
customer_reviews.text: Item was shipped quickly. I haven't had a chance to use it yet but hope to soon. I bought it because it stated it had a 150lb capacity BUT the info sheet that arrived with it states that it only has a capacity of 120lb. I bought it because I wanted something that was sturdy enough to hold the 150lb capacity that was promised. Hopefully it will work out for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jack DeHaven

customer_reviews.title: Best thing we have bought for our kayak
customer_reviews.text: Best thing we have bought for our kayak. assists in loading and moving accross the parking lot to the beach
customer_reviews.author: Don L.

customer_reviews.title: Put the back of your kayak on the frame and you're all set
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 62 yr old woman that would NOT be able to go kayaking alone without this set of wheels. They are so easy to use and lightweight. I use a bungee cord to secure my kayak and it works just fine. It's definitely worth purchasing especially if you go on the water by yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L. Badt

customer_reviews.title: Kayak Cart Works fine.
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my new 10 foot kayak with a strap and worked like a charm, walked 2 blocks with it no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and compact when folded. Sturdy with non-pneumatic tires. Holding strap secures it to the kayak well.
customer_reviews.author: Monk42

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for someone who loves to kayak but had a difficult time moving the kayak to and from car and water. She used it recently and was able to pull the whole thing down to the water rather than place it in her car, she was so happy that this made it so much easier to use! She was able to use her kayak much more frequently than before thanks to this rack!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my 12ft fishing kayak
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my 12ft fishing kayak. The tie-down strap that comes with the cart is very basic and could be improved and is the only reason I'm not giving this product 5 stars. I would recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: J. Carte

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I got home and found it on the porch, I opened the box popped the wheels on,and had to put my kayak on it. The one have a 12' long 69Lbs. I put just about center, strapped it down and it moves so easy. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: john materna

customer_reviews.title: quality assurance vs customer service
customer_reviews.text: I was bummed when I first got this product because one of the innertubes was flat and I loathe poor quality assurance but this company did it's best to resolve the problem for me in a timely manner. They sent me a whole new tire in a matter of a couple days after receiving my complaint. The cart it's self is great just what I wanted for moving my 10' kayak down to the lake
customer_reviews.author: 1Primeaddict

customer_reviews.title: love this kayak dolly
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect light wieght kayak dolly, just strap the kayak on and off you go. Works great on sand and gravel. It does have a wierd oder. I left it out side for a couple of weeks and now keep it inthe garage and do not notice the smell at all. This is a great value for the money, and it folds up so it is easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: R. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: I looked at every kayak dolly on the internet, and read reviews. This seemed like the best bet. So I took it out last weekend and had to traverse about 1/3 of a mile on paved road and then over sand and a little mud. This dolly performed great without problem. It is easy to figure out, and the only thing you have to do is put the tires on which is a snap to do. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Strap that comes with sucks but it does its job
customer_reviews.text: Positioning of this is difficult but once you find it it works well with a ratchet strap! Pelican 120 catch sit on top you have to put it at the end not in the middle like a 10 footer
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Holy crap, these tires smell awful
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap, these tires smell awful. Even after airing them out, they still reek. Granted, I didn't get this for the smell, and it sits in the garage. I gave this to my father as a Christmas present, and I had to put it into a different box (the original smelled absolutely atrocious.) Assembles easily and servs its purpose. The ties are a bit weak.
customer_reviews.author: David and Kelsey H.

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and really easy to transport kayak!
customer_reviews.text: Just hook on my kayak and pull it down to the lake! Easy!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: its good but a little bit of a balancing act for ...
customer_reviews.text: its good but a little bit of a balancing act for the wider kayaks. I use it with my vibe seaghost 130. Will probably buy one with a wider base in the future or one that just goes through the scupper holes.
customer_reviews.author: Philip DAvila

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my canoe
customer_reviews.text: No brainier, put together in less than a minute. It took longer to open the packaging. Works great on my canoe, no more struggling to get it where I need it to go. No smell on the tires by the way!
customer_reviews.author: Guy Clark

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Works great bringing my kayak up the ramp to my truck when the ramps blocked by other boaters, and makes loading easier. I haven’t tried it on surfaces other than gravel and concrete.
customer_reviews.author: Nick JD

customer_reviews.title: Great price and great product
customer_reviews.text: Great price and great product. I can haul two kayaks easily with this. I suggest a ratcheting tie down strap to make sure the kayak doesn't shift while pulling it. The one provided will only cause you misery. So so in sand, great everywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Honcho

customer_reviews.title: 100 lb, 12 foot bass kayak with no issues
customer_reviews.text: No thrills. Easy to use. No issues with strap. But if you want another one there cheap and readily available. Im using this on a big fish 120. So 12 ft. 100 lb boat. Ive had it on gravel, grass and boat ramps no problem. Used five times now with no issue. Will update.
customer_reviews.author: jeff butts

customer_reviews.title: Best choice products
customer_reviews.text: All previous complaints, air tires replaced with solid rubber tires ( so no air leak complaints) and now a thin metal buckle on the strap that goes around the kayak. Get balanced to about the middle and centered side to side...no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: They also worked great transporting our kayaks down the street to the bay
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly what we were looking for and the plastic/rubber smell that some people spoke about in past reviews was not at all evident. I ordered two, opened the box and they stayed in my foyer for 3 days before we packed our car for the beach. No smell. They also worked great transporting our kayaks down the street to the bay. Great price for a great carrier.
customer_reviews.author: D. Carter

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: not easy or great to attach to kayak. but works
customer_reviews.author: michael danchuk

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to keep on kyak
customer_reviews.text: Not worth it. Not easy to put on kyak to pull strap is crappy
customer_reviews.author: Camper lady

customer_reviews.title: Wheel size is misleading (4" wheels, not 10") -- might not work well on soft sand or rocky trail.
customer_reviews.text: The lead description says this cart has "10" Pneumatic wheels". That is not correct. The cart has 4" wheels. The diameter of the tires is approximately 9.5". The diameter of a tire on a 10" wheel would be 15" or more. The difference is important if one uses the cart to haul a kayak or canoe over soft sand or soft gravel or along a rocky trail. The detailed description is almost accurate: "large 10" diameter inflatable tires" vs actual 9.5".
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: BAD for Tri-hull or Cathedral hull kayaks.
customer_reviews.text: Works okay for single hull kayak, but on my cathedral hull, it's very unstable and difficult to turn.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph P.

customer_reviews.title: nice product reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I Have not used it yet, but it went together real easily.
customer_reviews.author: Billups

customer_reviews.title: Kayak Carrier
customer_reviews.text: Works great to get my kayak to & from the lakes water edge
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product helps with the long walks to the lake
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Grifith, Mr

customer_reviews.title: Good for sit inside kayaks
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. I did not realize you can only you it with sit inside kayaks easily, not sit on top kayaks. So after wrestling with this for over an hour I realized my mistake. But the construction is nice and sturdy. It does have a strong smell but I just left it outside.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Merithew

customer_reviews.title: pretty good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Could be a little higher quality, wheels could roll a little smother. But at less then half the price of all the others you really can't complain. A real life saver if you don't have one I don't know how you can even want to take your kayak out of the truck.
customer_reviews.author: KYLE

customer_reviews.title: Great product WHEELS STINK.
customer_reviews.text: This thing works as stated. BUT trust me when they say the wheels smell. THEY DO!! The smell like the strongest mothballs ever. If you are planning on leaving it in the house DON'T! I put it in my garage and I am going to take the wheels off and put them outside. Other than that this is a great product with a good price.
customer_reviews.author: kevin d gilbert

customer_reviews.title: I'm satisfied, as long as it holds up well
customer_reviews.text: The cart works well for my inflatable kayak. The smelly wheels were not a big issue for me. The cart came with one long strap and 2 buckles. I think you really need 2 straps, so will need to figure out what works for your kayak and adapt the straps and/or add another. I did need to pump up the tires with my bike pump. Overall, the cart seems to be nearly identical to those costing up to twice as much. I'm satisfied, as long as it holds up well.
customer_reviews.author: Janet  H. Dalen

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: This little lightweight kayak dolly trailer is a Godsend. After a full day of rowing it was so awesome to just pop it under the boat and push. No more lifting and carrying!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: it is great.
customer_reviews.text: Get a couple of ratchet straps to hold this to the kayak. If you traverse ANY ground with bumps, roots, boadrwalks, curbs, etc., the strap(s) that came with it won't hold stay in place. But, with a couple of ratchets, it is great.
customer_reviews.author: AthensMac

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little kayak dolly!
customer_reviews.text: Great little carrier. Easy to attach to large tandem kayak and handles the weight well. Love the stand feature and is usable on various kayak sizes. Not so great with a heavy kayak on the dry sand (it drags quite a bit) but excellent handling with a lighter kayak on sand or even with a heavy kayak on wet sand or pavement.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Sky

customer_reviews.title: Meets my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the trailer too many times yet, as I've only had it a month or so. The 5 star rating is for the value - this trailer works just like it should, and like others I have used in the past, but it was less expensive than many of the other brands. I take it down a road and onto a beach, so the terrain is flat. I recommend using a strap with a metal buckle, so you can secure the kayak tightly.
customer_reviews.author: Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: For the price this kayak cart is great. I havent had any issues using it. Goes together and come apart easily. I can store it in my kayak storage compartment with ease.
customer_reviews.author: mike regal

customer_reviews.title: This carrier works great for transporting a kayak
customer_reviews.text: This carrier works great for transporting a kayak. The only negative was the strap used to secure the kayak. I replaced the strap with an inexpensive ratchet type cinch that solved the problem and secured the kayak properly
customer_reviews.author: winston brown

customer_reviews.title: This tends to tip over easy. I have a longer kayak so I think ...
customer_reviews.text: This tends to tip over easy. I have a longer kayak so I think it would work better with a short kayak. I try to "load" the kayak on here and it is difficult without help.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Aside from the smell, no problems
customer_reviews.text: Shipment was fast an packaged well. Our only issue..and warning is if you get this OPEN IT OUTSIDE!! Wow the wheels stink to high heaven...you could get high off those fumes! But it serves it purpose, just have to keep it outside for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: momarch

customer_reviews.title: Yes and No
customer_reviews.text: It looked like a great deal for the price, but one of the wheels came with the tire stem buried behind the wheel. I could not get it out, but I had another old wheel that I exchanged for it. The manufacturing qualtiy seems to be quite low.
customer_reviews.author: Kayak Man

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Construction
customer_reviews.text: Well built Kayak cart makes moving you yak much easier.
customer_reviews.author: mbar

customer_reviews.title: Mine came with a flat tire. I took it ...
customer_reviews.text: Mine came with a flat tire. I took it to a bike shop to fill. They barely got the wheel off the rim and found a hole in the tube. They patched the tube - and none of us could get the tire back on the rim...
customer_reviews.author: debRates

customer_reviews.title: Perfect price and quality
customer_reviews.text: I shopped around for the carrier- at all of the local sporting shops and kayak dealers. I couldn't find anything for less than eighty dollars that spoke of any quality. The ebay purchase is perfect... high quality... will last ... and is perfect for my 16 foot ocean kayak that weighs over 50lbs.
customer_reviews.author: R.O.

customer_reviews.title: good cart
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I had to use my own personal strap to fit around my kayak, but the cart works great so far. Ive used it about 6 times and happy to have it.
customer_reviews.author: ca

customer_reviews.title: ... has worked ok for us but it doesn't work great in loose sand
customer_reviews.text: This cart has worked ok for us but it doesn't work great in loose sand. We usually end up having to carry it once we get to the sand. It also collapses pretty easily which can be frustrating when you are trying to put the kayak on it.
customer_reviews.author: Kylie Kopp

customer_reviews.title: kayak dolly
customer_reviews.text: you get what you pay for. waste of money. itll work but it tends to collapse when carry my tandem kayak. ended up buying another dolly that fits inside the scupper holes.
customer_reviews.author: sarge289

product_meta.title: Best Choice Products Aluminum Dolly Cart Carrier Transport Trolley for Kayak, Boat, Canoe w/ 10in Rubber Tires
product_meta.description:
Get a kayak or canoe from the car to the water with ease using this trolley. Built with large tires and a solid metal frame, this cart can easily hold and transport a kayak. It's designed with foam bumpers to protect and hold the boat by the hull in a V-shaped cradle. Quickly and easily load it out of the water with a spring-loaded stand. 

Specifications:
Foam Bumpers: 3.5"(L)
Spring-Loaded Stand: 9.25"(H)
Tires: 10"(Dia)
Weight Capacity: 150 lbs.
Weight: 7.7 lbs.
Color: Silver, Black
Material: Aluminum, PU Foam
No assembly required (with instructions)

Package Includes:
Trolley cart
12ft strap



BCP SKU: SKY1251
feature_bullets: Built with a sturdy aluminum frame and foam bumpers on each arm to protect your kayak or canoe hull
The support stand features a 10in spring-loaded stand to keep the dolly cart propped up onshore for quick loading out of water
Large, 10in foam tires can roll smoothly along gravel and sand
12ft straps can easily secure a full size kayak or canoe
Foldable and easy to store when not in use; Weight Capacity: 150 lbs.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars400 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
